definitions.definition: An event with a formal dress code.
definitions.example: Jenny took Sam to her Year 12 formal.

definitions.definition: Being in accord with established forms.
definitions.example: She spoke formal English, without any dialect.
I'd like to make a formal complaint.

definitions.definition: Relating to the form or structure of something.
definitions.example: Formal linguistics ignores the vocabulary of languages and focuses solely on their grammar.
The formal stage is a critical part of any child's development.
Formal wear must be worn at my wedding!

definitions.definition: Proper, according to strict etiquette; not casual.
definitions.example: He's always very formal, and I wish he'd relax a bit.
When they became a formal club the rowers built a small boathouse.

definitions.definition: Relating to mere manipulation and construction of strings of symbols, without regard to their meaning.
definitions.example: Formal series are defined without any reference to convergence.
